title: Lesson 93
paragraph: This lesson focuses on clarity and precision, emphasizing exact, unambiguous, and meticulous qualities.

words.meaning: clear and precise; not open to more than one interpretation
words.example: Her instructions were unambiguous and easy to follow.

words.meaning: showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise
words.japaneseMeaning: 細心の注意を払った、几帳面な
words.example: He kept meticulous records of all transactions.

words.meaning: including many small parts or features; thorough
words.example: The report provided a detailed account of the event.

words.meaning: diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details
words.example: She was scrupulous in her research methods.
The map provides an accurate depiction of the area.

words.japaneseMeaning: 首尾一貫した、筋の通った
words.example: The essay was coherent and easy to understand.

words.meaning: done or acting according to a fixed plan or system
words.example: She conducted a systematic review of all documents.
His explanation was lucid and convincing.

words.meaning: able to express ideas clearly and effectively
words.japaneseMeaning: 明確に表現する、はっきり話す
words.example: She is articulate in presenting her research findings.
